keyMoments.title: Flying Fish Riders Mentioned
keyMoments.description: The Flying Fish Riders are introduced as a very active kidnapping gang in the Sabaody area, led by the mysterious Iron Mask Duval.
keyMoments.significance: Introduction of the Flying Fish Riders as antagonists who operate in the slave trade business.

keyMoments.title: Flying Fish Riders Attack
keyMoments.description: The Flying Fish Riders launch an aerial assault on the Thousand Sunny, bombing the ship while riding their giant flying fish.
keyMoments.significance: First combat encounter demonstrating their unique fighting style using flying fish mounts.

keyMoments.title: Recognize the Straw Hat Flag
keyMoments.description: The Flying Fish Riders recognize the Straw Hat flag and immediately retreat under Duval's orders.
keyMoments.significance: Reveals that Duval has specific interest in the Straw Hat Pirates.

description: The Flying Fish Riders are a kidnapping gang led by Duval that operates near Sabaody Archipelago. They ride giant flying fish capable of aerial and underwater movement, making them formidable opponents. The crew engages in human trafficking and slave trading, working alongside the Macro Pirates. After Duval's confrontation with the Straw Hats, the crew is reformed and renamed the Rosy Life Riders, becoming allies of the Straw Hats.

reveals.information: Founded by Duval as a kidnapping gang operating near Sabaody Archipelago
Very active in human trafficking and slave trading business
Members ride giant flying fish that can move both in air and underwater at high speeds

keyMoments.title: Macro Gang Reveals Hatchan's Capture
keyMoments.description: Macro taunts Camie over the Den Den Mushi, revealing his crew captured Hatchan by teaming up with the Flying Fish Riders and plans to sell him as a slave.
keyMoments.significance: Introduction of the Macro Pirates as antagonists engaged in slave trading, showing the dark path some former Sun Pirates members took.

keyMoments.title: Macro Confirms the Trap
keyMoments.description: Macro reports to Duval that he successfully lured Camie to the base, revealing Hatchan's kidnapping was a calculated trap.
keyMoments.significance: Shows the alliance between Macro Pirates and Flying Fish Riders and their plan to trap the Straw Hats.

description: The Macro Pirates are a small three-member crew of fish-men led by Macro, consisting of himself, Gyaro, and Tansui. They are former members of the Sun Pirates who left after Jinbe became a Warlord of the Sea. Despite their origins with Fisher Tiger's anti-slavery crew, they have no qualms about engaging in human trafficking and slave trading, particularly targeting mermaids and fish-men for high prices. They attempted to kidnap Camie thirty-one times and allied with the Flying Fish Riders to capture Hatchan.

reveals.information: Small crew of only three fish-men: Macro, Gyaro, and Tansui
Former members of the Sun Pirates who left after Jinbe became a Warlord
Engage in slave trading despite their origins with the anti-slavery Sun Pirates
Attempted to kidnap Camie thirty-one times; target mermaids and fish-men for slave trade
